exercises.name: Child's Pose
exercises.description: Gentle resting pose that stretches the back and calms the mind
instructions: Kneel on the floor with big toes touching
Sit back on your heels
Separate your knees about hip-width apart
Fold forward, walking your hands out in front
Rest your forehead on the floor
Let your arms extend forward or rest by your sides
Breathe deeply into your lower back
Hold for 30 seconds to 2 minutes
exercises.breathCue: Inhale to lengthen spine, exhale to sink deeper

modifications.easier: Place a pillow between your thighs and calves
modifications.harder: Walk hands to one side for a side stretch

exercises.name: Downward Facing Dog
exercises.description: Energising full-body stretch that strengthens arms and stretches hamstrings
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders
Spread your fingers wide, press firmly through palms
Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the floor
Push your hips up and back towards the ceiling
Straighten your legs as much as comfortable
Let your head hang naturally between your arms
Push your heels towards (not necessarily to) the floor
Create a long line from wrists to hips

modifications.easier: Bend your knees generously, focus on lengthening spine
modifications.harder: Lift one leg to the sky (Three-Legged Dog)

exercises.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
exercises.description: Flowing spinal movement that warms up the back and improves flexibility
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Align wrists under shoulders, knees under hips
INHALE for Cow: Drop belly, lift chest and tailbone
Look slightly upward, shoulders away from ears
EXHALE for Cat: Round your spine towards ceiling
Tuck chin to chest, tailbone under
Move slowly, matching breath to movement
Repeat for 5-10 rounds
exercises.breathCue: Inhale = Cow (belly drops), Exhale = Cat (spine rounds)

modifications.easier: Make smaller movements, stay in comfortable range
modifications.harder: Add circles with your hips or shoulders

exercises.name: Warrior I
exercises.description: Powerful standing pose that builds leg strength and opens the chest
instructions: Stand at the top of your mat
Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet
Turn your back foot out at 45 degrees
Bend your front knee to 90 degrees, knee over ankle
Square your hips towards the front of the mat
Raise your arms overhead, palms facing each other
Lift your chest, gaze forward or slightly up
Hold for 5-10 breaths, then switch sides
exercises.breathCue: Inhale to lengthen, exhale to ground through feet

modifications.easier: Shorten your stance, hands on hips
modifications.harder: Deepen the front knee bend, add a slight backbend

exercises.name: Warrior II
exercises.description: Strong standing pose that builds endurance and opens the hips
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart, about 4 feet
Turn your right foot out 90 degrees
Turn your left foot in slightly, about 15 degrees
Bend your right knee to 90 degrees, knee over ankle
Extend arms out parallel to the floor
Keep shoulders stacked over hips
Gaze over your front fingertips
Hold for 5-10 breaths, then switch sides

modifications.easier: Don't bend front knee as deeply

exercises.name: Tree Pose
exercises.description: Classic balance pose that improves focus and strengthens ankles
instructions: Stand tall with feet together
Shift your weight onto your left foot
Place right foot on inner left thigh or calf (not knee!)
Press foot and leg into each other for stability
Find a fixed point to gaze at for balance
Bring hands to prayer position at heart
Option to raise arms overhead like branches
Hold for 5-10 breaths, then switch sides
exercises.breathCue: Breathe slowly to help maintain balance

modifications.easier: Foot on ankle with toes touching floor, or use a wall

exercises.name: Cobra Pose
exercises.description: Gentle backbend that strengthens the spine and opens the chest
instructions: Lie face down with legs extended behind you
Place hands under shoulders, elbows close to body
Press tops of feet and thighs into the floor
On an inhale, begin to lift your chest
Keep elbows slightly bent, shoulders away from ears
Lift only as high as comfortable — no pain in lower back
Use your back muscles, not just your arms
Hold for 15-30 seconds, breathing steadily
exercises.breathCue: Inhale to lift, maintain breath while holding

modifications.easier: Keep the lift very small (Baby Cobra)
modifications.harder: Straighten arms more for Upward Facing Dog

exercises.name: Pigeon Pose
exercises.description: Deep hip opener that releases tension in glutes and hip flexors
instructions: From Downward Dog, bring right knee forward
Place right knee behind right wrist
Angle right shin under your torso (doesn't need to be parallel)
Extend left leg straight back, top of foot on floor
Square your hips as much as possible
Walk hands forward and fold over front leg
Rest forehead on the floor or stacked hands
Hold for 1-2 minutes, breathing into the hip
exercises.breathCue: Long, slow breaths — let gravity do the work

modifications.easier: Place a block or pillow under front hip for support
modifications.harder: Keep torso upright, add a quad stretch by bending back knee

exercises.name: Seated Forward Fold
exercises.description: Calming stretch for the entire back body and hamstrings
instructions: Sit with legs extended straight in front of you
Flex your feet, toes pointing to ceiling
Sit up tall, lengthening your spine
Inhale and raise arms overhead
Exhale and hinge forward from your hips
Reach for shins, ankles, or feet — wherever you can
Keep your spine long rather than rounding excessively
Hold for 1-2 minutes, breathing into tight areas
exercises.breathCue: Inhale to lengthen, exhale to fold deeper

modifications.easier: Bend knees slightly, use a strap around feet
modifications.harder: Grab feet and pull chest closer to thighs

exercises.name: Corpse Pose
exercises.description: Final relaxation pose that integrates the practice and calms the nervous system
instructions: Lie flat on your back
Let your feet fall open naturally
Place arms alongside body, palms facing up
Close your eyes
Relax every muscle in your body
Start from your toes and work up to your face
Let your breath be natural and effortless
Stay for 3-10 minutes

modifications.easier: Place a bolster under knees for lower back comfort
modifications.harder: N/A — this is meant to be effortless

exercises.name: Standing Forward Fold
exercises.description: Releases tension in the back and stretches hamstrings
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Inhale and reach arms overhead
Exhale and hinge at your hips to fold forward
Let your head hang heavy
Bend knees as much as needed to be comfortable
Hold opposite elbows and gently sway
Or place hands on the floor, shins, or blocks
Hold for 30-60 seconds

modifications.harder: Grab behind ankles and pull chest to thighs

exercises.name: Bridge Pose
exercises.description: Gentle backbend that strengthens glutes and opens the chest
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Place feet hip-width apart, close to your bum
Arms rest alongside body, palms down
Press feet and arms into the floor
Lift your hips towards the ceiling
Roll shoulders underneath you, interlace fingers if comfortable
Keep thighs parallel — don't let knees splay out
Hold for 30-60 seconds, lower slowly
exercises.breathCue: Inhale to lift, exhale to hold

modifications.easier: Place a block under sacrum for supported bridge
modifications.harder: Lift one leg to sky, or interlace hands and walk shoulders closer
